title: BALLwitdaBALL
body_text:
Friends unified. Action intensified. Lives shaped forever.
A "Ball witda Ball" alright! Six of the very best ever divided into two of the most awesome, destructive combinations ever assembled! 2008 sensation
Bobby Vetrano
, Wrestle'Maniac'
Travis Mills
, and "Cockroach"
Juan Londono
epically clashed with fierce females powerhouse
Alison Bertsch
, "The unSTOPAble"
Lauren Stopa
, and first lady of dodgeball
Diana DiBuccio
! This never-before-witnessed "Battle of the Sexes" could have only happened at
EastCoastDodgeball's
150th presentation!
A grueling, five-hour war that seemingly showed no signs of termination.  The first moments of the feverishly-awaited collision set the stage for what would eventually become a "West Side Story".
Game 1, Team "Testosterone" took the early lead in this match-of-the-year contender. But before long, the ladies lashed back and captured their first point on the contest as well. It was apparent things would only get more heated as the night progressed.
The battle-scarring third round left the Wall High School battlegrounds drenched in a pool of sweat, specifically from a fantastic "Last Man Standing" performance by wily veteran Justin Pierce. His enduring effort was not enough however to overcome the male-dominating opponents and thus, Vetrano, Mills, and Londono went up one again. But the minor setback only further enraged the already-furious females, who racked up yet another point in their win column. DODGEBALL 150's predominant attraction was again all tied up at 2 apiece!
With the moon rearing its bright, white face in the starry summer sky, the intense 3-on-3 thriller was coming down to the wire. Games 5 and Games 6 would continue the apparent pattern with Vetrano/Mills/Londono regaining the one-point edge, only for the ladies to rebound back with a triumph of their own.
A limited amount of time was all that remained - the finish line oh-so near. Bertsch/Stopa/DiBuccio managed to knock out all but two of their adversaries, rivals-turned-allies Kevin Fitzpatrick and Chris Adams, in the seventh round. Once incomparable powerhouse "Fitz" was taken out of contention, the eldest Adams held his own for just seconds longer before the illuminating spotlights powered off. "The Axe" Adams's ability to avoid elimination saved the male alliance from certain defeat.
Bobby Vetrano, Travis Mills, and Juan Londono
fought
Alison Bertsch, Lauren Stopa, and Diana DiBuccio
to a 3 to 3 draw at the 150th presentation of
EastCoastDodgeball
. The sites, the sounds, the incredible displays of athleticism from this fantastically star-studded confrontation will never be forgotten.
The secondary attraction at this massively hyped extravaganza was the popular
MoneyMaker
Rimshot Contest. With a $1 entry fee, players and spectators were welcome to test their aim during this brief intermission. In the end, defending champion
Mike "Sputz" Krott
came out with the big win once again, defeating finalists Juan Londono and former one-time contest winner John Tronolone in a three-round showdown.
Other participants were Eamon Fitzpatrick, former two-time winner Chris Adams, Kerrin Marchese, Mr. Cornero, former one-time winner Ray Marzarella, Bill Plantz, former one-time winner Diana DiBuccio, Grandma Tronolone, former one-time winner Dan Spengeman, Georgi Gilmartin, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Bobby Vetrano, former three-time winner Ryan Letsche, Joan Whoeler, Dan Turner, Lauren Stopa, Joey Smalls, former two-time winner Travis Mills, and Mr. Tronolone.
The catching machine walked away with $24 extra bucks in his wallet!
Season 15
A jam-packed season from top to bottom -
Wolf-Juan II
in a thunderous downpour, "Championship Chase" winner Michael Edwards's undefeated captains streak snapped, a
Draft
, a Battle Royal, a
Player's Choice
Rimshot Contest, and the returning
Hit the Human
pregame competition! What more could you ask for?!
This 15th Season produced an average attendance of 28.6 and welcomed 22 new stars.
The only
Wet War
was DODGEBALL 142, where Juan Londono defeated Justin Wolf in a stunning rematch from DODGEBALL CXL. The first of six spots in the DODGEBALL 150 main event was on the line as well.
This was the first ten-week program that did not feature a
CREAMation Rules
encounter since the concept was first introduced in March 2007.
Kevin Megill, Justin Wolf, Mike "Sputz" Krott, Kevin Adams, Eamon Fitzpatrick, and John Tronolone participated in every Season 15 event, spanning from DODGEBALL 141 on June 7 to DODGEBALL 150 on August 9.
DODGEBALL 150
Wall High School never looked so good! Draped beach towels, dangling swimming pool noodles, paper palm trees, hanging boogie boards, beach balls, balloons, and sparkling garland each added to the colorful summer atmosphere!
Endless gallons of water, all natural fruit snacks, and delicious cupcakes and cookies were drank and eaten up by night's end.
The Spengeman-Tronolone soundtrack named
"DBFM"
, included all genres of music. Theory of a Deadman, Janet Jackson, Moby, Airbourne, The Police, New Kids on the Block, Taproot, and Rev Theory were just some of the artists featured on the five-hour compilation.
First three picks for
Bertsch/Stopa/DiBuccio
: K. Megill, J. Tronolone, J. Pierce
First three picks for
Vetrano/Mills/Londono
: K. Fitzpatrick, R. Letsche, C. Adams
Relatives that gave it another go following the memorable DODGEBALL CXL:
Family Affair
were
Mr. Cornero
,
Mr. Spengeman
, and
Grace Tronolone
.
Non-participating relatives on hand for DODGEBALL 150 were
Ms. Adams, Mrs. Fulton, Dan Karen, and Zoe Adams
(Mother, aunt, cousin, and dog of Chris, Steve, and Kevin Adams)
,
Ms. Huter
(Mother of Sascha Basista)
,
Terra Bergquist
(Mother of Zachary Bergquist)
,
Mr. Bertsch and Mrs. Bertsch
(Father and mother of Alison Bertsch)
,
Mrs. Cornero
(Mother of Bob, Grant, and Abigail Cornero, wife of Mr. Cornero)
,
Grandma and Grandpa Edwards
(Paternal grandparents of Michael Edwards)
,
Mr. Fitzpatrick
(Father of Kevin, Dan, and Eamon Fitzpatrick)
,
Mrs. Kerr and Jen Mullen
(Mother and future sister-in-law of Melissa Kerr)
,
Mr. and Mrs. Letsche
(Father and mother of Ryan Letsche, uncle and aunt of Bobby Vetrano)
,
Mrs. Londono and Catalina Londono
(Mother and sister of Juan Londono)
,
Mrs. Marchese
(Mother of Kerrin Marchese)
,
Mr. Megill and Mrs. Megill
(Father and mother of Kevin Megill)
,
Mr. Mills and Mrs. Mills
(Father and mother Travis Mills)
,
Mrs. Pellecchia
(Mother of Rob Pellecchia)
,
Mrs. Spengeman
(Mother of Dan Spengeman, wife of Mr. Spengeman)
,
Mr. Tronolone, Mrs. Tronolone, Megan Tronolone, and Grandma Tronolone
(Father, stepmother, sister, and paternal grandmother of John Tronolone)
, and
Mrs. Vetrano
(Mother of Bobby Vetrano, aunt of Ryan Letsche)
.
Online Exclusive!
It was a rocky road to DODGEBALL 150, as the six-person encounter seen at the event was altered numerous times en route to the big day. Superstars Grant Cornero and Tom Adams were originally scheduled participants in the 3-on-3 melee, but later declined entry due to injury and conflicting work schedule, respectively.
The idea behind a "gender division" had been talked about since the beginning of time, but never on such a grand stage like DODGEBALL 150. Once the final six were decided, "The Writer" took it upon himself one last time to change the match less than two weeks before showtime.
An event of this magnitude doesn't happen once a month, or even once a year. With beloved family and friends present, DODGEBALL 150 was a once-in-a-lifetime spectacle and only those who experienced it can explain why.
If eight-month old
Zachary Bergquist
and six-year old
Grace Tronolone
didn't put a smile on your face, then
Jim Butler's
seemingly pointless high-jump dodges sure as hell did. If neither did the trick, you can always count on kamikaze
Steve Adams
sacrificing his body at the frontline throughout the five-hour show.
The modern-day "Golden Girls"
Joan Whoeler
,
Georgi Gilmartin
, and
Grandma Nancy Tronolone
giving it a whirl in the highly-anticipated Rimshot Contest received a nice ovation from the onlookers as did the masterful game-ending catch by first overall choice
Kevin Megill
stopping a
Grant Cornero
-launched bulletball dead in its tracks.
The admirable, Game 3 performance from icon
Justin Pierce
, the "Ohs!" and "Ahs!" in reaction to the vicious nutshot delivered to
Bob Cornero
, and the comical catching mishap from
Derek Carty
and
Chris Adams
will all be talked about years from now.
DODGEBALL 150 hit a jackpot attendance, reaching the
second highest
position for any event with an incredible
51
participants. This is just
one
person shy of last year's DODGEBALL 100. The turnout was comprised of 40 men and 11 women.
Four new players
- Bethany Schonberg, Karen Shih, Ryan Kerr
(brother of Melissa Kerr)
, and Abigail Cornero
(sister of Bob and Grant Cornero, daughter of Mr. Cornero)
- made their presence felt at this milestone extravaganza.
Familiar faces
returning to the dance were Kerrin Marchese whose over year and half-long dodgeball hiatus came to an end. Jim Martin and Dave Curtis also reemerged after lengthy absences.
The official theme song was "Bawitdaba" by Kid Rock.
DODGEBALL 150 was the eighth season finale held on the back courts of Wall High School.
August ties the month of March for the most number of season finales with three. DODGEBALL 30 in 2006, DODGEBALL 80 in 2007, and DODGEBALL C30 in 2008 took place in March while DODGEBALL 50 in 2006, DODGEBALL 100 in 2007, and now DODGEBALL 150 were each held in August.
The second
MoneyMaker
Rimshot Contest was won by
Mike "Sputz" Krott
, who pocketed a $24 pot. This was his second contest victory having won the first
MoneyMaker
Rimshot Contest at DODGEBALL C30.
The "Battle of the Sexes" main event split six of the most recognized names in history into two formidable factions. Bobby Vetrano, Travis Mills, and Juan Londono fought Alison Bertsch, Lauren Stopa, and Diana DiBuccio to a surprising 3 to 3 tie. This was just the second season finale that ended in a tie score, the other being DODGEBALL CXL:
Family Affair
.
Bobby Vetrano
made his ten event captains debut. This was his first team battle. His record is 0-2-1.
Travis Mills
made his second ten event captains appearance, having headlined the Season 4 Finale, DODGEBALL XL, against Joe Kelly. This was his first team battle. His record is 0-2-1.
Juan Londono
made his second ten event captains appearance, having headlined the Season 14 Finale, DODGEBALL CXL, against Justin Wolf. He is just the second player to co-captain a three-person team more than once, the other being Kevin Fitzpatrick. He is also the third player to headline two straight ten events, joining the likes of John Tronolone (20, 30) and Justin Pierce (90, 100). His record is 6-2-2.
Alison Bertsch
made her second ten event captains appearance, having headlined the Season 11 Finale, DODGEBALL CX, teaming with Michael Butler against Melissa Kerr and Mike "Sputz" Krott. Alison is the first woman in history to headline a ten event more than once. Her record is 2-4-2.
Lauren Stopa
made her ten event captains debut. She had participated in several big time match-ups, including a mid-season main event and the special annual anniversary in 2007. Her record is 1-3-1.
Diana DiBuccio
made her ten event captains debut. She broke her own record for number of matches ending in a draw. Her record is 4-4-4.
Excluding DODGEBALL 150 newbies, the following competitors made their ten event debut: Eamon Fitzpatrick, Andrew Feiter, Jarid Putman, and Zachary Bergquist.
It Sounded All Too Sweet!
The 80-song, five-hour long soundtrack kicked ass thanks to the countless hours put in by Dan Spengeman and John Tronolone.
EastCoastDodgeball
also appreciates Justin Wolf's participation, having provided speakers.
I'm Likin' the Menu!
A big-ups to everyone who provided food for the occasion, specifically Kathryn Nogueira and the Wolf Family for their time spent in the kitchen.
Backstage Pass!
There is an endless list of superstars and spectators that assisted in setting up the unique decorations.
EastCoastDodgeball
thanks each of you for your time and effort.
We May Bend, But We Don't Break!
Just when it seemed impossible to reach such a milestone, the dodgeball crew does it again. From the long-time veterans of yester-year to the diehard competitors of today,
thank you
so very much for your commitment and participation. There would be no weekly Saturday activity, no irreplaceable bonds, no dodgeball without all of you.
body_html:
Friends unified. Action intensified. Lives shaped forever.


A "Ball witda Ball" alright! Six of the very best ever divided into two of the most awesome, destructive combinations ever assembled! 2008 sensation Bobby Vetrano, Wrestle'Maniac' Travis Mills, and "Cockroach" Juan Londono epically clashed with fierce females powerhouse Alison Bertsch, "The unSTOPAble" Lauren Stopa, and first lady of dodgeball Diana DiBuccio! This never-before-witnessed "Battle of the Sexes" could have only happened at EastCoastDodgeball's 150th presentation!

A grueling, five-hour war that seemingly showed no signs of termination. The first moments of the feverishly-awaited collision set the stage for what would eventually become a "West Side Story".

Game 1, Team "Testosterone" took the early lead in this match-of-the-year contender. But before long, the ladies lashed back and captured their first point on the contest as well. It was apparent things would only get more heated as the night progressed.

The battle-scarring third round left the Wall High School battlegrounds drenched in a pool of sweat, specifically from a fantastic "Last Man Standing" performance by wily veteran Justin Pierce. His enduring effort was not enough however to overcome the male-dominating opponents and thus, Vetrano, Mills, and Londono went up one again. But the minor setback only further enraged the already-furious females, who racked up yet another point in their win column. DODGEBALL 150's predominant attraction was again all tied up at 2 apiece!

With the moon rearing its bright, white face in the starry summer sky, the intense 3-on-3 thriller was coming down to the wire. Games 5 and Games 6 would continue the apparent pattern with Vetrano/Mills/Londono regaining the one-point edge, only for the ladies to rebound back with a triumph of their own.

A limited amount of time was all that remained - the finish line oh-so near. Bertsch/Stopa/DiBuccio managed to knock out all but two of their adversaries, rivals-turned-allies Kevin Fitzpatrick and Chris Adams, in the seventh round. Once incomparable powerhouse "Fitz" was taken out of contention, the eldest Adams held his own for just seconds longer before the illuminating spotlights powered off. "The Axe" Adams's ability to avoid elimination saved the male alliance from certain defeat.

Bobby Vetrano, Travis Mills, and Juan Londono fought Alison Bertsch, Lauren Stopa, and Diana DiBuccio to a 3 to 3 draw at the 150th presentation of EastCoastDodgeball. The sites, the sounds, the incredible displays of athleticism from this fantastically star-studded confrontation will never be forgotten.


The secondary attraction at this massively hyped extravaganza was the popular MoneyMaker Rimshot Contest. With a $1 entry fee, players and spectators were welcome to test their aim during this brief intermission. In the end, defending champion Mike "Sputz" Krott came out with the big win once again, defeating finalists Juan Londono and former one-time contest winner John Tronolone in a three-round showdown.

Other participants were Eamon Fitzpatrick, former two-time winner Chris Adams, Kerrin Marchese, Mr. Cornero, former one-time winner Ray Marzarella, Bill Plantz, former one-time winner Diana DiBuccio, Grandma Tronolone, former one-time winner Dan Spengeman, Georgi Gilmartin, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Bobby Vetrano, former three-time winner Ryan Letsche, Joan Whoeler, Dan Turner, Lauren Stopa, Joey Smalls, former two-time winner Travis Mills, and Mr. Tronolone.

The catching machine walked away with $24 extra bucks in his wallet!


Season 15
  • A jam-packed season from top to bottom - Wolf-Juan II in a thunderous downpour, "Championship Chase" winner Michael Edwards's undefeated captains streak snapped, a Draft, a Battle Royal, a Player's Choice Rimshot Contest, and the returning Hit the Human pregame competition! What more could you ask for?!
  • This 15th Season produced an average attendance of 28.6 and welcomed 22 new stars.
  • The only Wet War was DODGEBALL 142, where Juan Londono defeated Justin Wolf in a stunning rematch from DODGEBALL CXL. The first of six spots in the DODGEBALL 150 main event was on the line as well.
  • This was the first ten-week program that did not feature a CREAMation Rules encounter since the concept was first introduced in March 2007.
  • Kevin Megill, Justin Wolf, Mike "Sputz" Krott, Kevin Adams, Eamon Fitzpatrick, and John Tronolone participated in every Season 15 event, spanning from DODGEBALL 141 on June 7 to DODGEBALL 150 on August 9.

    • DODGEBALL 150
  • Wall High School never looked so good! Draped beach towels, dangling swimming pool noodles, paper palm trees, hanging boogie boards, beach balls, balloons, and sparkling garland each added to the colorful summer atmosphere!
  • Endless gallons of water, all natural fruit snacks, and delicious cupcakes and cookies were drank and eaten up by night's end.
  • The Spengeman-Tronolone soundtrack named "DBFM", included all genres of music. Theory of a Deadman, Janet Jackson, Moby, Airbourne, The Police, New Kids on the Block, Taproot, and Rev Theory were just some of the artists featured on the five-hour compilation.
  • First three picks for Bertsch/Stopa/DiBuccio: K. Megill, J. Tronolone, J. Pierce
  • First three picks for Vetrano/Mills/Londono: K. Fitzpatrick, R. Letsche, C. Adams
  • Relatives that gave it another go following the memorable DODGEBALL CXL: Family Affair were Mr. Cornero, Mr. Spengeman, and Grace Tronolone.
  • Non-participating relatives on hand for DODGEBALL 150 were Ms. Adams, Mrs. Fulton, Dan Karen, and Zoe Adams (Mother, aunt, cousin, and dog of Chris, Steve, and Kevin Adams), Ms. Huter (Mother of Sascha Basista), Terra Bergquist (Mother of Zachary Bergquist), Mr. Bertsch and Mrs. Bertsch (Father and mother of Alison Bertsch), Mrs. Cornero (Mother of Bob, Grant, and Abigail Cornero, wife of Mr. Cornero), Grandma and Grandpa Edwards (Paternal grandparents of Michael Edwards), Mr. Fitzpatrick (Father of Kevin, Dan, and Eamon Fitzpatrick), Mrs. Kerr and Jen Mullen (Mother and future sister-in-law of Melissa Kerr), Mr. and Mrs. Letsche (Father and mother of Ryan Letsche, uncle and aunt of Bobby Vetrano), Mrs. Londono and Catalina Londono (Mother and sister of Juan Londono), Mrs. Marchese (Mother of Kerrin Marchese), Mr. Megill and Mrs. Megill (Father and mother of Kevin Megill), Mr. Mills and Mrs. Mills (Father and mother Travis Mills), Mrs. Pellecchia (Mother of Rob Pellecchia), Mrs. Spengeman (Mother of Dan Spengeman, wife of Mr. Spengeman), Mr. Tronolone, Mrs. Tronolone, Megan Tronolone, and Grandma Tronolone (Father, stepmother, sister, and paternal grandmother of John Tronolone), and Mrs. Vetrano (Mother of Bobby Vetrano, aunt of Ryan Letsche).

    • Online Exclusive!
    It was a rocky road to DODGEBALL 150, as the six-person encounter seen at the event was altered numerous times en route to the big day. Superstars Grant Cornero and Tom Adams were originally scheduled participants in the 3-on-3 melee, but later declined entry due to injury and conflicting work schedule, respectively.

    The idea behind a "gender division" had been talked about since the beginning of time, but never on such a grand stage like DODGEBALL 150. Once the final six were decided, "The Writer" took it upon himself one last time to change the match less than two weeks before showtime.


    An event of this magnitude doesn't happen once a month, or even once a year. With beloved family and friends present, DODGEBALL 150 was a once-in-a-lifetime spectacle and only those who experienced it can explain why.

    If eight-month old Zachary Bergquist and six-year old Grace Tronolone didn't put a smile on your face, then Jim Butler's seemingly pointless high-jump dodges sure as hell did. If neither did the trick, you can always count on kamikaze Steve Adams sacrificing his body at the frontline throughout the five-hour show.

    The modern-day "Golden Girls" Joan Whoeler, Georgi Gilmartin, and Grandma Nancy Tronolone giving it a whirl in the highly-anticipated Rimshot Contest received a nice ovation from the onlookers as did the masterful game-ending catch by first overall choice Kevin Megill stopping a Grant Cornero-launched bulletball dead in its tracks.

    The admirable, Game 3 performance from icon Justin Pierce, the "Ohs!" and "Ahs!" in reaction to the vicious nutshot delivered to Bob Cornero, and the comical catching mishap from Derek Carty and Chris Adams will all be talked about years from now.


    DODGEBALL 150 hit a jackpot attendance, reaching the second highest position for any event with an incredible 51 participants. This is just one person shy of last year's DODGEBALL 100. The turnout was comprised of 40 men and 11 women.

    Four new players - Bethany Schonberg, Karen Shih, Ryan Kerr (brother of Melissa Kerr), and Abigail Cornero (sister of Bob and Grant Cornero, daughter of Mr. Cornero) - made their presence felt at this milestone extravaganza.

    Familiar faces returning to the dance were Kerrin Marchese whose over year and half-long dodgeball hiatus came to an end. Jim Martin and Dave Curtis also reemerged after lengthy absences.

    The official theme song was "Bawitdaba" by Kid Rock.

    DODGEBALL 150 was the eighth season finale held on the back courts of Wall High School.

    August ties the month of March for the most number of season finales with three. DODGEBALL 30 in 2006, DODGEBALL 80 in 2007, and DODGEBALL C30 in 2008 took place in March while DODGEBALL 50 in 2006, DODGEBALL 100 in 2007, and now DODGEBALL 150 were each held in August.

    The second MoneyMaker Rimshot Contest was won by Mike "Sputz" Krott, who pocketed a $24 pot. This was his second contest victory having won the first MoneyMaker Rimshot Contest at DODGEBALL C30.

    The "Battle of the Sexes" main event split six of the most recognized names in history into two formidable factions. Bobby Vetrano, Travis Mills, and Juan Londono fought Alison Bertsch, Lauren Stopa, and Diana DiBuccio to a surprising 3 to 3 tie. This was just the second season finale that ended in a tie score, the other being DODGEBALL CXL: Family Affair.
    • Bobby Vetrano made his ten event captains debut. This was his first team battle. His record is 0-2-1.
    • Travis Mills made his second ten event captains appearance, having headlined the Season 4 Finale, DODGEBALL XL, against Joe Kelly. This was his first team battle. His record is 0-2-1.
    • Juan Londono made his second ten event captains appearance, having headlined the Season 14 Finale, DODGEBALL CXL, against Justin Wolf. He is just the second player to co-captain a three-person team more than once, the other being Kevin Fitzpatrick. He is also the third player to headline two straight ten events, joining the likes of John Tronolone (20, 30) and Justin Pierce (90, 100). His record is 6-2-2.
    • Alison Bertsch made her second ten event captains appearance, having headlined the Season 11 Finale, DODGEBALL CX, teaming with Michael Butler against Melissa Kerr and Mike "Sputz" Krott. Alison is the first woman in history to headline a ten event more than once. Her record is 2-4-2.
    • Lauren Stopa made her ten event captains debut. She had participated in several big time match-ups, including a mid-season main event and the special annual anniversary in 2007. Her record is 1-3-1.
    • Diana DiBuccio made her ten event captains debut. She broke her own record for number of matches ending in a draw. Her record is 4-4-4.
    Excluding DODGEBALL 150 newbies, the following competitors made their ten event debut: Eamon Fitzpatrick, Andrew Feiter, Jarid Putman, and Zachary Bergquist.




    It Sounded All Too Sweet!
    The 80-song, five-hour long soundtrack kicked ass thanks to the countless hours put in by Dan Spengeman and John Tronolone. EastCoastDodgeball also appreciates Justin Wolf's participation, having provided speakers.

    I'm Likin' the Menu!
    A big-ups to everyone who provided food for the occasion, specifically Kathryn Nogueira and the Wolf Family for their time spent in the kitchen.

    Backstage Pass!
    There is an endless list of superstars and spectators that assisted in setting up the unique decorations. EastCoastDodgeball thanks each of you for your time and effort.

    We May Bend, But We Don't Break!
    Just when it seemed impossible to reach such a milestone, the dodgeball crew does it again. From the long-time veterans of yester-year to the diehard competitors of today, thank you so very much for your commitment and participation. There would be no weekly Saturday activity, no irreplaceable bonds, no dodgeball without all of you.
